Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Second generation restaurant space available
National Retailers here include Harris Teeter, Brixx Pizza, Orange Theory Fitness, and Wells Fargo

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Meadowmont Village is a 224,846 sf retail property located in Chapel Hill, NC. Meadowmont Village is an upscale lifestyle center that serves the affluent Chapel Hill community. The center is located near University of North Carolina-Chapel Hill, which has an enrollment of 26,000 students.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Transcendent mixed-use, multi-family project
13,445 square feet of ground floor retail
265 units of luxury housing
Outstanding visibility and access to strong daytime & evening population
Less than two  miles from Interstate 40

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Berkshire Chapel Hill is a new mixed-used development adjacent to Whole Foods on Elliott Road, a high-profile location just minutes from the heart of Downtown Chapel Hill and the University of North Carolina.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: High profile building located along Franklin Street in the heart of Chapel Hill’s downtown
Building recently went through a complete renovation
Street level access is perfect for a wide range of users including retail, office and medical
Walking distance to numerous amenities and the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill campus
Rare opportunity to invest in iconic Chapel Hill Corner - 5,671 SF total available
Directly across from UNC-Chapel Hill Campus with 30,000 students and 12,000 staff and faculty
Irreplaceable Asset at Franklin St and Columbia St (“Main & Main”)
Upside opportunity to lease prime endcap space on Franklin St
Franklin Street is Chapel Hill’s social epicenter for UNC students and staff, area residents, visitors and daytime workers
Extreme barriers to entry for new development
Value Creation in leasing 2nd Floor Space
Affluent and highly educated demographic base
Daytime population over 84,000 within 3-mile radius
Adjacent to UNC Medical Center with a staff of more than 7,100 employees which serves more than 37,000 people per year
Walking distance to the planned Innovation Hub project which will add 370,000 sf of office/wet lab space and generate 800 new jobs in downtown Chapel Hill
Property Located in Opportunity Zone

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: 5,671 SF for Lease in Downtown Chapel Hill

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: 52,000 SF of first-class ground floor retail and dining opportunities
156,000 SF of unique Class "A" office space

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: A collaborative partnership between Cousins Properties, Northwood Ravin, and CBRE|Raleigh, Carolina Square creates a dynamic mixed-use project acting as a new hub of activity in Chapel Hill. The site provides unparalleled exposure and access to UNC's campus along Franklin Street.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: A Mixed-Use Revolution in the Heart of Chapel Hill

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Prominently positioned in Chapel Hill’s most walkable retail corridor along Franklin Street, the site is located adjacent to the University of North Carolina (29,000+ students enrolled)
Up to 6,808 SF of second generation restaurant space available (can be subdivided) with outdoor patio and visibility on W Franklin Street
Directly across from Carolina Square, a brand new mixed use development encompassing 42,000 SF of retail (anchored by Target), 159,000 SF of Class A office space, along with 246 apartment units
Cotenants include Que Chula, Spicy 9, Summit Coffee, and Sotheby’s International Realty
Built-in customer base with 140 luxury apartments located above ground floor retail

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: Second Generation Restaurant Space in the Heart of Chapel Hill

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Directly adjacent to Carolina Square
On-site parking available
Located at “Main & Main” and surrounded by numerous restaurants

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Prominently positioned in Chapel Hill’s most walkable retail corridor, the site is located directly across from the University of North Carolina (29,000+ students enrolled).

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Large mixed-use development approved in municipality with extremely high barriers to entry
Surrounded by affluent neighborhoods with easy access to I-40, UNC and Duke campuses
Extremely rare opportunity for building visibility and signage from I-40
3 additional drive-thrus (very rare in Chapel Hill)
Within 3 miles, 77% have obtained bachelor degree or higher
Local school system is among the best in the state, attracting families from across the country
Located adjacent to the complimentary Park-and-Ride lot (operated by the Chapel Hill Transit) in addition to ample on-site parking
400 luxury apartments on-site, with prices ranging from $1,200 - $3,000
On-site drive-in movie theater program opened in Q4 2020, The Drive-In at Carraway Village, complete with food trucks, outdoor games, and container bar
